metadata.title: CVE-2018-7186 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Leptonica before 1.75.3 does not limit the number of characters in a %s format argument to fscanf or sscanf, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a long string, as demonstrated by the gplotRead and ptaReadStream functions. It was discovered that Leptonica incorrectly handled input arguments. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

criterions.comment: leptonlib package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.75.3-2').
